documents.t: Features on the mobile phone include：
View the alarm log and control log
Fill in the properties of the device
View the data pushed by the gateway device via MQTTBox
Defects in this optimization and fix

ThingsPanel is an underlying open source software of the Internet of Things, the main function is to collect device data, visualization, automation control, for many integrators, equipment vendors, solution providers to provide rapid product and delivery solutions. ThingsPanel's mobile app is used to provide mobile management and control support to ThingsPanel.The main implemented functions include monitoring, control, policy, and device addition management.Is a lightweight client for ThingsPanel that supports SAAS scenarios.

Using Uniapp development, it can be easily compiled into iOS, Android, WeChat Mini Program and other Mini Programs, H5. You can scan the code to add a device (the device needs to be imported in the background first). View the monitoring values. Switch between intelligent service and device groupings. Manual control. set the control policy, There are two types: device trigger and time condition trigger. Review the operation log. Personal account management function. Mobile phone verification code login. ThingsPanel-APP mobile client login page ThingsPanel-APP Home
documents.s: Features on the mobile phone include：

documents.t: Release notes​ This release revises many of the questions raised by previous users, especially the management of large-scale devices, access to complex devices, and how to efficiently forward data to third parties.In addition, this time it is also an overall test of performance, simulating 10,000 devices to stress test the system, and achieving a single TimescaleDB node 5000 devices/s access capability (4 cores 8G).In terms of permissions, horizontal fine to the operation and button, a relatively complete RBAC permission support has been established.Of course, it also includes a lot of detail improvements.
documents.s: ThingsPanel-0.3.0 was released, adding a rule engine, a permission system, and optimizing device access

documents.t: This release revises many of the questions raised by previous users, especially the management of large-scale devices, access to complex devices, and how to efficiently forward data to third parties.In addition, this time it is also an overall test of performance, simulating 10,000 devices to stress test the system, and achieving a single TimescaleDB node 5000 devices/s access capability (4 cores 8G).In terms of permissions, horizontal fine to the operation and button, a relatively complete RBAC permission support has been established.Of course, it also includes a lot of detail improvements.
Demo address：http://dev.thingspanel.cn Account password User name：admin@thingspanel.cn Password：123456

Added Redis as a caching module Added RBAC permission management module, using the Casbin permission framework, and the granularity of permissions is specific to devices, buttons or interfaces Added a role management page to support multiple roles. Added a permission management page, permissions fine-grained to the operation. The system backend adds support for Docker environment variables for easy configuration. Simplified deployment and increased adaptation to HUAWEI CLOUD / Alibaba Cloud. Added access rule engine and data forwarding function. Rewritten Business - Device Grouping - Device Module, supporting unlimited device grouping Added log of operation device, support query manual operation and automatic operation records

Optimized first login loading speed. Optimized the overall UI. Optimized indexing and sorting of some tables to improve the fluency of operations. The standard of stress testing has been raised and various aspects of performance and structure have been optimized. Optimized automated alerting and control strategies. User added features and pages rewritten. Optimized the alarm information page.

The next version, number 0.4.0, is functionally planned to learn from HomeAssistant, implement a more open structure, increase the group of shared chart components, and make the development of plug-ins simpler and more efficient plug-in development.The major structural issues that existed before ThingsPanel will be improved, especially on large integration projects, and the efficiency will be very prominent.

CoAP can be accessed in the following ways Use the ThingsPanel rule engine to access and convert to standard device access. Use The ThingsBoard Gateway or other software gateways to access. Use the hardware gateway to access and switch to MQTT to access ThingsPanel
Use the ThingsPanel rule engine to convert to standard device access.

Modbus是一种串行通信协议，是Modicon公司（现在的施耐德电气 Schneider Electric）于1979年为使用可编程逻辑控制器（PLC）通信而发表。Modbus已经成为工业领域通信协议事实上的业界标准，并且现在是工业电子设备之间常用的连接方式。 Modbus允许多个 (大约240个) 设备连接在同一个网络上进行通信，举个例子，一个由测量温度和湿度的设备，并且将结果发送给计算机。在数据采集与监视控制系统（SCADA）中，Modbus通常用来连接监控计算机和远程终端控制系统（RTU）

消息队列遥测传输（英语：Message Queuing Telemetry Transport，MQTT）是ISO 标准（ISO/IEC PRF 20922）下基于发布 (Publish)/订阅 (Subscribe)范式的消息协议，可视为“资料传递的桥梁”，它工作在 TCP/IP协议族上，是为硬件性能低下的远程设备以及网络状况糟糕的情况下而设计的发布/订阅型消息协议，为此，它需要一个消息中间件，以解决当前繁重的资料传输协议，如：HTTP。 MQTT 是一种简单的消息传递协议，设计用于具有低带宽的受限设备。因此，它是物联网设备接入的完美解决方案。
ThingsPanel平台提供了标准的 MQTT 接入协议，支持 MQTT v3.1/v.5，任何支持 MQTT 协议的设备都可以通过相应的 MQTT 客户端代码接入平台。
MQTT devices can be plugged directly into the system. MQTT设备如果是网关，一种方式是通过规则引擎转化为标准设备再接入到系统中。 接入类型 认证 接入地址 MQTT username/password普通认证方式 mqtt://{服务IP}:1883

MQTT 连接参数 值 说明 username AccessToken 设备创建后自动生成（用户也可自己修改），每个设备唯一。 password password 创建设备后可选输入项 clientId 随机 为保证设备安全，客户端id请使用大于6位的随机字符 info ThingsPanel 对同一个设备身份信息只支持一个 MQTT 连接，如果在两个或多个物理设备中，使用同样的 username/password 身份信息连接，平台仍然将这些连接视为同一个设备，这会导致后一个设备连接成功后会顶掉之前的设备连接。
消息类型 主题 设备上报属性主题 device/attributes 网关设备上报属性主题 gateway/attributes 设备上报事件主题 device/event 设备服务指令响应主题 device/command/reply 上报属性消息规范​ {key1:value1, key2:value2 ...} 例如： {"temp":18.5, "hum":40}
消息类型 主题 订阅属性主题 device/attributes/{AccessToken} 网关设备订阅属性主题 gateway/attributes/{AccessToken} 事件上报的响应主题 event/response/{accesstoken} 服务指令主题 command/send/{accesstoken}

OPC UA的全名是OPC Unified Architecture（OPC统一架构）。是OPC基金会应用在自动化技术的机器对机器网络传输协议。 OPC UA支援两种通讯协定，这两种通讯协定的差异只有URL的不同，二进制通讯协定是opc.tcp://Server，而Web服务的通讯协定是http://Server，其他情形下，OPC UA对应用程序接口的作业完全透明，其他作业不受OPC UA的影响。 二进制通讯协定的效率最高，其overhead也最少，让需要的资源最小化（不需要XML解析器、SOAP及HTTP，对嵌入式系统格外重要），提供最佳的互操控性（在实现时，二进制通讯协定提供较少的自由度），使用任意选取的TCP通道，可以较容易的进行隧道协议，也可以从透过防火墙开启。 Web服务（SOAP）通讯协定可以支援许多不同的工具（包括Java环境或是.NET环境的工具），使用标准HTTP(S)埠，可以和防火墙共同使用。 所有的实现方式都支援二进制通讯协定，但只有用.NET实现的设备才支援SOAP。
ThingsPanel对接opc-ua设备【通过规则引擎】 https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1G14y1a7iN/?spm_id_from=333.999.0.0
ThingsPanel对接自定义TCP设备【通过规则引擎】 https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1Xe411K7Lk/?spm_id_from=333.999.0.0

ThingsPanel is a general-purpose, open source IoT application platform designed to reduce development efforts and simplify and accelerate IoT development delivery through reusable components. Standard Device Pluginis the biggest feature of ThingsPanel, through which the complexity of the Internet of Things is greatly reduced.Further reduce costs and improve efficiency.At the same time, it also reduces the difficulty and cost of operation and maintenance.
On-device cloud vs. enterprise IoT+. Open source, AGPLv3. Simple and easy to use. Modular build for faster project delivery.
Deliver projects quickly Quickly develop your own solutions Device IoT+
For the slow and complex development of IoT projects.

Golang：inherently superior concurrency performance, saving hardware costs, and can be applied to edge devices. Vue .js：front-end build for a better experience PostgreSQL：higher load capacity and lower cost of ownership. TimescaleDB ：time series database, PostgreSQL plugin. Nginx：high-performance web server. GMQTT：high-performance message queuing processing. Redis：NoSQL cache database
Under development and not yet released

On the Data Management page, you can query all data sent from the device to the server. You can filter the data by selecting business, device grouping, token, date range. also supports exporting the queried data to an Excel file. Figure：

Go to Device Management from the business list to manage devices. On the Device List page, you can view, add, modify, and delete devices. tip ThingsPanel's device grouping can be compared to a partition of a disk (such as a C drive), a sub-device grouping can be compared to a folder, and a device is like a file. info For steps, seeCreate a Device.
The platform supports automated alerting and automated control policies.

tip After you create a business, the automation list also appears with columns for the corresponding business. ClickAutomationthe main menu to enter the automation list, find the corresponding business, and click theAlarm Policybutton in the Actions column to enter the alarm policy list. Click theAdd Alarm Policybutton to configure the policy pop-up window. Fill in the rules of the alarm policy and select the alarm notification method. info The Community Edition currently supports email notifications, which requires you to enable and configure the email service in the backend ./initialize/send_message/message.yml.

In the Business Row Actions column corresponding to the automation list, clickControl Policyto enter the control policy list. Click theNew Policybutton, and the Policy Configuration pop-up window appears. Fill in the rule saving of the alarm policy.

Trigger the alarm, the platform will record the alarm information, you can clickalarm informationthe main menu to filter to view the historical alarm information. Trigger control or manually operate the device on the platform, and the platform records the control log, which can be viewed in theDevice Logsubmenu underSystem Log.
documents.s: View the alarm log and control log

documents.t: This section shows you how to add a device from zero.

tip Devices depend on device grouping, and device grouping depends on business, so you need to create business and device grouping before creating a device. Business ->New business： Select theBusinessmain menu, click theNew Businessbutton, enter the business name pointSavebutton to add a new business.

Business->Device Management ->Management Grouping ->Add： Click theDevice Managementbutton in the business operation bar to enter the device list page of the business. Device groups need to be grouped before you can create a build. Click the top of the list toManage Groupsbutton to eject the dialog. On the Manage Device Grouping dialog box, click theAddbutton, enter the group name to close the dialog box to create a group. info You can addsubgroups to device groupings, and subgroups are also allowed under subgroups.

Business->Device Management ->Create a device： Back on the device management page, click theCreate Devicebutton, fill in the device name according to the prompts, select the device group, and select the device plug-in to create the device.

tip After creating the device, we also need to fill in the basic properties of the device to dock the device. Click the DevicePush ParametersColumnedit parameterstab to bring up the Edit Parameters dialog box. Select the device's protocol and continue entering the rest when prompted, the device needs to push data as prompted in the default configuration box. Then click theEdit Dockingtab in theData Dockingcolumn, pop up the Edit Docking dialog box, and click New to fill in the device-side field name corresponding to the preset value of the plug-in. tip At this point, the device has been created, and you can use the mqtt or socket tool to simulate the push message test according to the prompts in the protocol default configuration box.
documents.s: Fill in the properties of the device

documents.t: In this example we will implement the following points： Configure the industrial gateway to collect Modbus temperature and humidity data via RS485 and connect an audible and visual alarm. Push data to ThingsPanel's MQTT gateway. Add devices and get data Add a configuration visualization Manually control the sound and light alarm alarm. Configure temperature alarms over 30°.
documents.s: Temperature and humidity collection and alarm

documents.t: This example requires the following conditions to be prepared. Install ThingsPanel and run properly. Preparation of an industrial gateway (this time using the Golden Pigeon S475 gateway) A 485 communication temperature and humidity sensor An audible and visual alarm A section of network cable or An Internet of Things card (this time use the network cable to connect to the router)
Connecting the purchased device takes about 10 minutes (check with the gateway provider for the connection method).

Important items to configure are：IP address, port, subject,.If there is authentication, do not fill in the wrongusername password. In the above example, the gateway is configured with push topics separately.The server side parses the gateway (Golden Pigeon) separately.
You can see that the data has been received.The temperature of 282° as shown below (the raw data sent directly from the device)
documents.s: View the data pushed by the gateway device via MQTTBox

documents.t: tip After pushing the data, you can clickData Managementthe main menu to view the data received by the platform.(separate data for a device according to the filter bar) , device management page, <code> last pushcolumn shows last push time.(If empty, the new device has not pushed data yet)
After the device pushes the data to the platform, the device's data can be visualized.

Visualization ->New： Click theVisualizationmain menu to enter the visualization list. Click theNewbutton on the visualization page, enter a visualization name, and select the corresponding business to create a visualization.

Visualization ->Visualization Chart ->+： Click theVisualization Chartbutton in the Visualization Actions column to enter the visualization panel tip Enter the visualization panel, the default is the overview visualization panel of the entire business, you can select the device grouping according to the``drop-down box to switch to the grouping panel Click the plus sign in the upper right corner and select a chart cell to add to the chart to the visualization panel Chart cells are draggable and retractable. Moving the mouse over the chart cell displays small function buttons where you can set the data sample rate, time interval, and refresh rate. info Chart units can be customized according to the officially availableplug-in development package.

The full name of OTA "Over-The-Airtechnology", that is, over-the-air download technology, through the interface of mobile communication to achieve remote management of software, simply put, is the remote upgrade of firmware.

Product Management -> Firmware Upgrade On the list page you can view information about the firmware that has been currently upgraded, including the firmware name, attribution product, version number, and upgrade time.

Product Management -> Firmware Upgrade -> New Firmware Attributed Product：Select the product category to which you want to upgrade the firmware in the drop-down box. Firmware Name：is a user-defined name that identifies the firmware. Version Number：user-defined to distinguish between different versions of the same firmware that have been upgraded multiple times, example：V1.0.1 Signature Method：Encryption mode for MD5 and SHA256 Upload Firmware：Drag the upgrade package of the firmware you want to upgrade here, or click Upload.
Based on a visual stream programming tool, it is very easy to implement the access rules of the device.
Rule Engine -> Access Engine -> Create Access Rule Click theCreate Access Rulebutton and fill in the custom rule name.

Rule Engine -> Access Engine -> Edit Once the rule is created, you can click theEditbutton to enter the visual flow programming tool and edit the node. how to do the Flow Programming Tool can be found in the： Rule Engine as shown in Figure： Once you're done editing, don't forget to clickSave and run the, otherwise the rule won't take effect.

Rule Engine -> Access Engine -> Start/Pause When we edit a rule in the stream programming tool and save it, we can do it directly in ThingsPanelstart the/Pause, you no longer need to open the streaming programming tool.
Based on a visual stream programming tool, data forwarding to devices can be implemented very easily.
Rule Engine -> Data Forwarding -> Create Forwarding Rule Click theCreate Forwarding Rulebutton and fill in the custom rule name.

Rule Engine -> Data Forwarding -> Edit Once the rule is created, you can click theEditbutton to enter the visual flow programming tool and edit the node. Details of how the streaming programming tool works can be found in： rules engine like graph： Once you're done editing, don't forget to clickSave and run the, otherwise the rule won't take effect.

Rule Engine -> Data Forwarding -> Launch/Pause When we edit a rule in the stream programming tool and save it, we can do it directly in ThingsPanelstart the/Pause, you no longer need to open the streaming programming tool.

What is the rules engine?​ The rules engine is an extremely important functional module of the IoT platform, which is the engine that handles complex logic, which processes and passes messages between the device and the IoT platform according to the conditions set by the user.

The original message reported on the device is processed and transformed, and the data required by the server is generated and stored in the database. Forward the properties reported on the device to a third-party server. When a device reports a property that meets a certain condition, issue a command to another device.

The rules engine is an extremely important functional module of the IoT platform, which is the engine that handles complex logic, which processes and passes messages between the device and the IoT platform according to the conditions set by the user.
The Injection node allows you to inject a message into the flow, find theInjectnode in the node on the left, and drag it into the editor.As shown：
debugnode prints debugging information in the debug sidebar, find thedebugnode in the node on the left and drag it into the editor.
Connect the Inject node and the Debug node together by dragging between the output port of one node and the input port of another node. The effect is shown in the figure：
At this point, the node exists only in the editor and must be deployed to the server to take effect. Click the "Save and Run" button on the top right corner.
Click the "Inject" button.In the debug information bar we will see the output information.
The system administrator creates permissions, each corresponding to the directory/menu/route/button.After you create it, assign it to the corresponding role on the Role Management page.
System Administration -> Rights Management -> Add Permissions
System administrators can create different roles (positions), each with several different permissions.
System Administration -> Role Management -> Add Role Click the Add Role button, fill in the name of the role (position), and click Save.
System Administration -> Role Management -> Edit Role Click the Edit button to modify the name of the role.
System Administration -> Role Management -> Rights Management Click the Rights Management button to assign permissions to the role.
System Administration -> Role Management -> Delete The system administrator can delete the specified role by clicking the Delete button.
System Administration -> System Settings -> General Settings In the general settings interface, you can configure the title, theme and logo of the platform
System administrators can create multiple users (staff), each user (staff) assigned one or more roles (positions), each with different permissions.

System Administration -> User Management -> Add User Click the Add User button to fill in the pop-up dialog box with name, email address, phone, 123456 you can use the default password, or you can set your own password. At the same time, we can assign the corresponding role (position) to the user, and check the corresponding role. Finally, click Save and the user is created.
System Administration -> User Management -> Edit User Click the Edit button to modify the user's (staff member's) name, email address, etc., and reassign the user's role (position).
System Administration -> User Management -> Modify Password The system administrator can reset the login password for the user by clicking the Edit button.
System Administration -> User Management -> Delete The system administrator can delete the specified user by clicking the Delete button.
Records the actions of people logged on to the system for security audits.
In the Visualization module of Things Panel, users can customize the visualization chart of the device, as well as the components used to interact with the device.

When users enter the visualization chart interface via a visualizable page, they first show the user a general view of the business's equipment. includes the total number of devices, the number of offline devices, the number of online devices. Figure： If there is no overall view of the device, you can add a total device chart by clicking the+button in the top right. Users can display the visualization or interaction they want to view by selecting the Device Group drop-down list Then click+button to add a chart for that grouping
GitHub Plugin Development Kit info At present, the plug-in development package is still in the testing stage and does not represent the final development package.
For example, on the basis of ThingsPanel, other non-IoT functions such as OA, website, production management, e-commerce platform, and financial management are added.

tip InstallDocker Desktopandgitin a windows environment. Install docker dnf config-manager --add-repo <https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/docker-ce.repo>dnf install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.iosystemctl start docker.servicesystemctl enable docker.service Install docker-compose curl -L "<https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/download/v2.9.0/docker-compose>-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-composechmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose If git is not installed dnf install git -y

Pull items # Pull docker configurationgit clone https://github.com/ThingsPanel/thingsPanel-go-docker.gitcd thingsPanel-go-docker Run the project In thethingsPanel-go-dockerdirectory (win needs to opencmd window) # Start a project in the foreground mode with a log display (default account and password super@super.cn 123456) (default port 8080) docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml up # Or start the project in a way that hides the log display docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d # stop service docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml down

View mounted volumes (followed by non-./beginning directories are volumes) Docker volume ls docker volume inspect xxx thingspanel-go #后端 thingspanel-html #前端 thingspanel-postgres #数据库 System logs ./init_files/backend/logs/ Plugin directory There is no need to restart the container thingspanel-go/extensions/ Back-end code directory Here you can update and compile your code, and then restart the backend container after compilation thingspanel-go The front-end code directory You can place the vue packaged files here and restart the front-end container thingspanel-html

Port： 8080 (front-end service port)9998 (tcp port)9999 (API port)1883 (mqtt port)5432 (postogresql port)6379 (redis port) mqtt subscribes to topics：thingspanel.telemetry mqtt default account：guest mqtt default password：guest test case Temperature and humidity data push：{"token":" 123456","type":"ep","values":{"temp":23.0,"hum":13}} Note the distinction between numbers and strings
Minimum configuration CPU 1 core memory 1GB hard disk 20G Recommended configuration CPU 2 cores+ memory 4GB+ hard disk 40GB+

ThingsPanel is developed using Golang, and the platforms supported by Golang are as follows： aix/ppc64 android/386 android/amd64 android/arm android/arm64 darwin/amd64 darwin/arm64 dragonfly/amd64 freebsd/386 freebsd/amd64 freebsd/arm freebsd/arm64 illumos/amd64 js/wasm linux/386 linux/amd64 linux/arm linux/arm64 linux/mips linux/mips64 linux/mips64le linux/mipsle linux/ppc64 linux/ppc64le linux/riscv64 linux/s390x netbsd/386 netbsd/amd64 netbsd/arm netbsd/arm64 openbsd/386 openbsd/ amd64 openbsd/arm openbsd/arm64 plan9/386 plan9/amd64 plan9/arm solaris/amd64 windows/386 windows/amd64 windows/arm

tip You can refer to the following methods, and the specific situation needs to be adjusted according to the test. Based ononline toolfill in your hardware arguments to generate your reference configuration.
Increase the syslog level and reboot the system./conf/app.conf,on the backend
Depending on the situation, you can choose the source code installation.
info See read the README installation steps forCode Base.

It can support various data acquisition and equipment control application scenarios, including energy, electricity, transportation, mines, communities, buildings, parks, agriculture, meteorology, emergency response, etc.

The computer side uses the URL, and the mobile phone side scans the code http://dev.thingspanel.cn/ The computer and mobile phone share the account password User name：admin@thingspanel.cn Password：123456
Design systems with common sense thinking. Solve complex problems in simple ways. Higher level of abstraction. Simplify the system with standardized components

The same temperature and humidity sensor, there may be thousands of manufacturers, different specifications and models, but they are alltemperature and humidity sensor. The inputs of the temperature and humidity sensor are temperature, humidity, and time.The output is a chart unit or report such as current temperature, current humidity, temperature curve, humidity curve, etc.The number and relationship between these inputs and outputs is determined. Therefore, we also abstract the software part of the temperature and humidity sensor into a standard temperature and humidity sensor component, which includes a fixed data input and result output.And make it a standard brick in the IoT building.
Server status information, including CPU and memory usage, number of device messages.
create multiple projects, create project according to the attribute structure, and group them at unlimited levels. A project can bind a user to achieve user authorization for the project.

Add management devices in groups.Get the device push parameter for data pairs. View the device push status, the chart component of the device plug-in, and quickly filter the device according to the grouping and device plug-in. Provides device wizard for newcomers. Unlimited groupings can be managed.

You can create multiple visualizations. A business can create grouped and aggregated visualizations. The chart units contained in the device plug-in are automatically read and loaded. You can set the refresh rate, sample rate, and time interval. Various icon modules, report units are supported. Drag-and-drop layout

You can add control policies and alarm policies Supports controlling policy priority. Supports multiple control policies or conditions Two trigger types are supported: time and device triggering. Supports multiple control commands to be issued at the same time. Support different policies for different businesses.
Filter data based on time period based on business. View the received data log in real time to facilitate monitoring whether the data has been received. Data can be exported.
Displays alarm information according to business and grouping. You can filter based on the time period.
View the access paths of different IPs in the system for security audits. View any records of the device being operated, both manually and automatically, by what conditions triggered it.
Manage device plug-ins, which are shadow devices of devices, including data and protocol definitions, data processing, and graphical report units for device output.

Casbin scheme supports ACL and RBAC multiple permission management methods, and supports large-scale business permission control. Support permission control to the page. Supports separate permission control for projects. Support multi-role definition and custom role permissions.
Forward the received data to third parties. Receive device data and convert the format.
Create products, set product codes, export product production data Import products and generate QR codes OTA functionality.
Replace the logo. Change the system title. Change the theme style.

Using Uniapp development, it can be easily compiled into iOS, Android, WeChat Mini Program and other Mini Programs, H5. You can scan the code to add a device (the device needs to be imported in the backend first). View the monitoring values. Switch between intelligent service and device groupings. Manual control. Set the control policy, which is divided into two types: device triggering and time condition triggering. Review the operation log. Personal account management function. Mobile phone verification code login.

Added Redis as a caching module Added RBAC permission management module, using the Casbin permission framework, and the permission granularity is specific to buttons or interfaces Added a role management page Added permission management page The backend added support for Docker environment variables Simplified deployment and increased adaptation to HUAWEI CLOUD/Alibaba Cloud Added access rule engine and data forwarding function The service-device grouping-device module has been rewritten to support unlimited device grouping Added log of operation device, support query manual operation and automatic operation records

Optimized first login loading speed Optimized the overall UI Optimized indexing and sorting of some tables to improve the fluency of operations The standard of stress testing has been raised and various aspects of performance and structure have been optimized Optimized automated alerting and control strategies User added features and pages rewritten Optimized the alarm information page

Added the main menu of system settings, support for replacing all logos and system names on the system Added the device properties feature to populate the device location to locate the device in the business visualization Optimized the TCP protocol and added a device reset API interface Added an external extension interface：query device history data based on device id Added external extension interface：provides an interface for input device data and pictures Added a picture preview function to data management and fixed the time not showing defect Added the external extension interface：query the current value of all devices and devices under the service according to the service id Added external extension interface：query the current value of the device based on the device id Added the ability to export data to excel A log module has been added in the background, which can configure the number of split lines, 8 log levels, and log saving time in the app.conf configuration file; sql logging is at the info level Alarm information supports service ID, asset ID, and device ID retrieval Added dynamic loading logo and changed the loading style

Fixed an issue where automated alerts or associated events caused service downtime Optimized the non-switching issue of switching assets in the visualization and optimized the switching loading speed Optimized the issue of long loading time of login pages Optimized the issue where the line breaks of chart fields in application management can make the box taller Fixed a bug where the temperature and humidity visualization plug-in graph could not be loaded The title and layout of all plugins have been optimized Optimized the configuration of the front-end packaging deployment part, which is coordinated with docker one-click deployment Optimized the docker version, supporting the update of the front-end code, front-end code and nginx configuration on the docker version Optimized the retrieval function of data management, fixed some bugs, and enhanced the user experience; Optimized the editing business in the business and reduced the display delay; Partial names have been modified
documents.s: Defects in this optimization and fix

documents.t: Stand-alone performance: 5,000 devices can be accessed at the same time, and the number of devices accessed per minute is 300,000 units. Test method Kunpeng General Purpose Computing Enhanced || 4vCPUs | 8GiB 5000 temperature and humidity sensors, 1 second to report the message Test the project Stand-alone performance Access the device every minute Back-end services 50000TPS 3 million devices Message receiving 50000TPS 3 million devices database 5000TPS 300,000 devices
